column2: Sarah, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After taking Seroquelxr 300 for a few months, I benefited from a 15 pound lost about the 2nd month  and lost of appetite so this was a welcomed side effect-daytime hours were ok also but I began having disturbing nightmares which I grew accustomed to then weaned off and over the next two weeks or so began taking Latuda 40 then 80 I had to eat massive amounts of 350+ calories nausea then had convulsion like transition to go to sleep The nightmares became worst I don't know if it was from the transition from serqoquel or not I was afraid to go to sleep after two months I suddenly stopped.I feel great during the day though Oh and yes there was weight gain Now on lamictal about 3/4 months so far ok but can't sleep

column2: tinkerbellrae, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 822, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: debbieguymoore, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is by far the BEST PSYCH DRUG I have EVER had!! I am 51 and have been on psych drugs since I was 23 and have been bipolar and have ptsd and general anxiety disorder and have been on ALL the PSYCH drugs I think ever invented. I have NEVER been able to take an antipsychotic that works this well AND with NO BAD SIDE EFFECTS so far. (been on it 2 months!) I have NOT GAINED ANY WEIGHT AT ALL - HUGE PLUS!!!! I had never heard of Latuda before the day I started it and I missed a few doses on my second month and was an instant basket case and after a double dose (approved by my DR) to get my blood level built back up, I was a completely different person and nice again! I was having bad anger rages before this and they just STOPPED immediately! I am SO much happier and so THANKFUL for this med and I WOULD SUGGEST giving it a try.  My life has had such a turnaround and I attribute it to LATUDA!! I have had some muscle problems while on it but I had them before but seems like they got a bit worse, but not so bad that I would consider stopping it. I give it an 11 out of 10!! From a HAPPY customer!

column2: Colorado B, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking Latuda after being diagnosed with Bipolar I/Schizophrenia.  Beforehand, I had tried Risperdal, which made me very emotional (and gave me stomach fat) and Seroquel which made me a zombie.  Latuda has worked amazingly on my conditions, although it took 6-8 weeks to fully suppress my abnormal thoughts and feelings (even though it took only 2 weeks to begin combatting my concomitant sleep maintenance insomnia).  My only concern is that I've been taking it with Lamictal and, after 3.5 months, my liver diagnostics look badly off the charts.  I am tapering off the Lamictal to see if Latuda alone does not cause this.  Wish me luck.

column2: GettinOffLatuda, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Was on Latuda for over a year (40mg dose at night) for extreme insomnia due to anxiety and depression. It helped me get to sleep (usually) but did nothing for keeping me asleep so I continued to wake 5-7x/night. It does nothing for my anxiety. However I would say it did have some antidepressant properties b/c I became very depressed off of it. Main side effects that developed was an unpleasant twitching of my scalp and nose (and sometimes a few fingers) at night or in the morning. Also, b/c it needs to be taken with 350+ calories I gained about 13 pounds from the extra meal at night. It didn't leave me feeling hungover like the small dose of Seroquel I used to take though. Still, I am experimenting with my Dr for new (and hopefully better) options.
